blocks.name: cconngr
blocks.content: Extend class notation with connected graphs.

blocks.name: df-conngr
blocks.content: Define the class of all connected graphs. A graph is called _connected_ if there is a path between every pair of (distinct) vertices. The distinctness of the vertices is not necessary for the definition, because there is always a path (of length 0) from a vertex to itself, see ~ 0pthonv and ~ dfconngr1 . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 2-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 15-Feb-2021.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-conngr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  |- wceq(cconngr, cab(s0, wsbc(s1, cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wral(s3, cv(s1), wex(s4, wex(s5, wbr(cv(s4), co(cv(s2), cfv(cpthson, cv(s0)), cv(s3)), cv(s5)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s3, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
}

axiom df-conngr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  ⊢ ConnGraph = { s0 |[(Vtx ` s0)/ s1]∀(s2 ∈ s1, ∀(s3 ∈ s1, ∃(s4, ∃(s5, s4[(s2[(PathsOn ` s0)]s3)]s5))))}
  ⊣ d(s0, s4)
  ⊣ d(s2, s4)
  ⊣ d(s3, s4)
  ⊣ d(s4, s5)
  ⊣ d(s1, s4)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)
  ⊣ d(s0, s5)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s2, s3)
  ⊣ d(s2, s5)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s3, s5)
  ⊣ d(s1, s3)
  ⊣ d(s1, s5)
}

blocks.name: dfconngr1
blocks.content: Alternative definition of the class of all connected graphs, requiring paths between distinct vertices. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 15-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: isconngr
blocks.content: The property of being a connected graph. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 2-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 15-Feb-2021.)
